lexUnit.name: yell.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shout in a loud or piercing way.

sentence.text: ` Clear off ! " he yelled .
“ Stop ! ” he yelled .
The neighbours came to their kitchen windows better to see the antics of this strange lady , and I managed to yell , ` Get Trudie , quick ! "
` How could it have happened ? " he yelled .
Half-way along it , Ember whipped round to yell , ` Go , Jez ! " and vaulted over the hand-rail .
` What do you think ? " she yelled .
` Then do n't behave like her , " he yelled .
He saw me and yelled : ` Shallot , where have you been ?
Sue leaned over to Derek and yelled : ` I think I love you . "
` Get out , " yelled Philip .
` She kidnapped me ! " yelled Griselda .
` Come on ! " yelled Cardiff , and seized one of Jimmy 's arms , dragging him to his feet .
` Special Beatles souvenir , " yelled the hawkers , peddling their twenty-four-page picture booklets .
` What is he going to destroy ? " yelled Rafiq .
To encourage her , Trent yelled that the road was in sight .
Edward managed to retrieve the canoe and got it uprighted and then we heard Marge and Jerry on the opposite shore yelling that they were OK .
" For God 's sake , Maureen , you were yelling yesterday that you could n't be bothered with it .
She said : ` I brushed past a girl as I went to the toilet and she yelled I 'd done it deliberately .
George moved to stand on my foot just as Katy discovered a pound coin and Christopher yelled it was his .
The driver yelled something at her as he passed , and the bystanders regarded her disapprovingly .
She all but yelled the words at him , incensed beyond reason that he could even consider such a thing .
Charles was too concerned with Jacqui even to yell the usual obscenities at the Swede .
When I 'd called in at Sunil 's place after Prentice had driven off , Nassim was on the landing yelling orders to the builders who were crashing around in the bathroom .
The foreman yelled something to the ceiling in another language and stomped toward the door saying , ` The whole world is crazy , I tell you .
He no longer had the strength to yell instructions to the men on the catamaran .
The driver yelled an order for silence over his shoulder and flapped his reins .
People were stirring now , yelling French in unison , splashing , exclaiming , swearing , someone put on a tape .
The captain with the clip-board ran over to the offending gun-team , yelling abuse .
And though I yelled a few more descriptive expressions , neither she nor Posi replied .
Sorrel busied herself fetching glasses while she yelled the introductions .
This time she yelled his name , not giving a damn if she looked a fool , and dived after him .
Paula yelled an urgent warning .
She yells it again .
He yelled the name as loudly as he could .
` Aspirin -- the bottle held aspirin ! " she all but yelled the words back at him .
You know he yelled at Auntie Lou yesterday because he slipped on that mat in the hall ?
` Where are you taking that bag ? " she yelled at him .
Tabitha yelled at the alien invader .
Then she yelled at nobody in particular , ` Who 's doing this ?
Just as they reached the top and comparative safety , Lilley yelled for everyone to bale out .
They threw each other around and the audience yelled for more .
I was yelling for Flupper to help , to do something , anything .
Kaas leant forward and dragged Adam to his feet as he yelled for the guards to come in and help him .
Sidney beat on the door with the flat of his hand and yelled for Joe .
As he saw the first men fall in the ambush , Lachlan 's shipmaster yelled for his men to fall back .
We yelled to 'er to keep still while we looked round for summat to throw to 'er to catch 'old of .
At about four o'clock he opened it and yelled to Emmie to fetch the Elastoplast .
` Run ! " he yelled to Lou , and the two boys , acting as if they were being pursued by the evil agents of an alien warlord , fairly streaked along the road .
` Look out ! " he yelled warningly to someone behind .
He turned and yelled to the woman who was polishing a glass at the other end of the bar .
` Mind your own damn business , woman , " Buddie yelled back .
` I do n't know -- " Maggie yells back as they cross the main road at a run .
` Oh be quiet and sit down , " Mary yelled back .
` Like hell I 'm not ! " he yelled back at her , tugging at his trousers and attempting to rise at the same time .
“ Here … mister , ” he yelled out and struggled to the front .
Not even thinking to stop , Jack dashed through and then whirled round as someone yelled out , ` You ! "
The officer sneezed and six of them yelled out ` Here sir ! "
The King yelled out , ` I 'll buy the lot !
Flashing through the birch wood came the white Mercedes-Benz , from which he leapt in his greatcoat and then dashed across the yard yelling out orders .
I had to yell out for him to hang on a minute . "
` Left what ? " he yelled over the noise of the engine and the wind .
` Where are we goin' first ? " he yelled over the wind noise .
` Shut up , dogs , " she yelled over her shoulder .
` Surprise , " they yell up at him .
Simon yelled up at them .
Miguelito yelled up that the man should do something unmentionable to himself .
